newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian copper prices extend losses, nickel gains.
newsitem.headline: Indian copper prices extend losses, nickel gains.

text.p: Indian copper prices fell, nickel regained lost ground while other base metals were unchanged in metals trading on Thursday, dealers said.
"Ready copper fell by 100 rupees to 12,700 rupees per quintal on fresh arrivals," one dealer said.
Nickel on the other hand recovered from earlier falls, gaining by 200 rupees to 37,500 rupees per quintal on fresh support from the stainless steel industry.
Aluminium, zinc and lead were firm at previous levels. Tin was steady at 36,000 rupees per quintal in nominal trade.
